sen.j: 菅沼 定仍（すがぬま さだより）は、戦国時代 (日本)の武将、江戸時代の大名。
sen.e: Sadayori SUGANUMA was a busho (military commander) in the Sengoku period (Japan) and a daimyo (feudal lord) in the Edo period.
Sadayori SUGANUMA was a busho (military commander) in the the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) (Japan) and a daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 「戦国時代」の部分を修正補いました。feudal lord→Japanese territorial lord と修正しました。
sen.e: Sadayori SUGANUMA was a busho (military commander) in the the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) (Japan) and a daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Edo period.
He was the lord of Abo domain in Kozuke Province.
He was the lord of Abo Ddomain in Kozuke Province.
He was the lord of Abo Ddomain in Kozuke Province.

sen.j: 伊勢国長島藩の初代藩主。
sen.e: He was the first lord of Nagashima domain in Ise Province.
He was the first lord of Nagashima Domain in Ise Province.
He was the first lord of Nagashima Domain in Ise Province.

sen.j: 天正4年（1576年）、菅沼定盈の次男として三河国野田で生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in 1576 at Noda in Mikawa Province as the second son of Sadamitsu SUGANUMA.
He was born in 1576 at Noda in Mikawa Province as the second son of Sadamitsu SUGANUMA.
He was born in 1576 at Noda in Mikawa Province as the second son of Sadamitsu SUGANUMA.

sen.j: 父の隠居で家督を継いだ。
sen.e: He succeeded to the head of family when his father retired.
He succeeded as the head of family when his father retired.
He succeeded as the head of family when his father retired.

sen.j: 慶長5年（1600年）の関ヶ原の戦いにも参加し、駿河国興国寺城や駿府城、美濃国岐阜城の守備を担当した。
sen.e: He participated in the Battle of Sekigahara in 1600 and took charge of the guard of Kokokuji-jo castle and Sunpu-jo castle in Suruga Province as well as Gifu-jo castle in Mino Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: He joined the Battle of Sekigahara in 1600 and took charge of the guard of Kokokuji-jo Castle and Sunpu-jo Castle in Suruga Province as well as Gifu-jo Castle in Mino Province.
sen.cmt: participated in→joined,castle→Castle と修正しました。
sen.e: He joined the Battle of Sekigahara in 1600 and took charge of the guard of Kokokuji-jo Castle and Sunpu-jo Castle in Suruga Province as well as Gifu-jo Castle in Mino Province.

sen.j: その功績により慶長6年（1601年）6月、1万石加増の2万石で伊勢国長島藩主として移封された。
sen.e: Thanks to the above contribution, he was entitled to additional 10.000 koku (1 koku is about 180 litter of rice yeild) and assigned as the lord of Nagashima domain in Ise Province as a daimyo of 20.000 koku..
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: As the praise to his contribution, he was entitled to additional 10.000 koku (1 koku is about 180 litters of rice yield) and assigned as the lord of Nagashima Domain in Ise Province as a daimyo of 20.000 koku..
sen.cmt: As the praise to his contribution と修正しました。litter→litters,yeild→yield,domain→Domain と修正しました。
sen.e: As the praise to his contribution, he was entitled to additional 10.000 koku (1 koku is about 180 litters of rice yield) and assigned as the lord of Nagashima Domain in Ise Province as a daimyo of 20.000 koku..

sen.j: しかし生来から病弱の上、父や正室が死ぬという不幸も追いうちをかけた。
sen.e: However, he was born weak and he lost his father and legal wife successively.
However, he was born weak and he lost his father and legal wife successively.
However, he was born weak and he lost his father and legal wife successively.

sen.j: このために重病に倒れて療養していた最中の慶長10年（1605年）10月25日、京都で死去した。
sen.e: Under such circumstances, he became seriously ill and died in Kyoto on December 5, 1605.
Under such circumstances, he became seriously ill and died in Kyoto on December 5, 1605.
Under such circumstances, he became seriously ill and died in Kyoto on December 5, 1605.
His age at death was 30.
His age at death was 30.
His age at death was 30.

sen.j: 継嗣が無かったため、弟の定芳が養子として後を継いだ。
sen.e: As he had no successor, his younger brother Sadayoshi became his adopted son and succeeded to the head of family.
As he had no successor, his younger brother Sadayoshi became his adopted son and succeeded as the head of family.
As he had no successor, his younger brother Sadayoshi became his adopted son and succeeded as the head of family.

sen.j: 墓所：京都府亀岡市西堅町の宗堅寺。
sen.e: Graveyard: Sogen-ji Temple, Nishikata-machi, Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Graveyard: Sogen-ji Temple, Nishikata-machi, Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Graveyard: Sogen-ji Temple, Nishikata-machi, Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture.
